title: Satire, Super8, and a squeeze of David Fincher: how the Succession opening credits were made
text:
HBO’s Succession has risen up over two seasons to become the most addictive thing on television. In a sense, though, it had us at hello, thanks to an electrically scored opening title sequence which heaves the mansion doors of American wealth wide open, and takes a grandiose stroll down those corridors of power.

Before our introduction to the Roy family – a backstabbing media dynasty, headed by Brian Cox’s ruthless but fraying paterfamilias – this intro was an arresting puzzle. About half of it consists of 8mm home-video snippets from some childhood dream of the 1970s – all tennis whites, poolside lounging and sun-kissed garden games, complete with children riding on an elephant.
